thread.title: Atlantic Shore wins in overtime with 2-point conversion
thread.title_full: Atlantic Shore wins in overtime with 2-point conversion | HamptonRoads.com | PilotOnline.com

author: John Acree
title: Atlantic Shore wins in overtime with 2-point conversion
text:
NORFOLK Atlantic Shores Christian School coach Wayne Lance didn't panic when his team fell behind 21-7 with less than four minutes remaining in the first half.
"This is what we wanted," Lance told his team just after Norfolk Academy's Victor Robinson scored on a 55-yard run. "We wanted a challenge, we got a challenge. Now, let's go to work."
The Seahawks rallied, then won 36-35 in overtime.
"There were times we could have just folded up the tent, but we stuck it out," Lance said."But we just kept playing, and this is how it turns out. Iron sharpens iron."
The Seahawks, who improved to 6-0, scored on a 1-yard run by quarterback Ryan Chamberlain late in the fourth quarter to pull within one point. The Seahwks went for two but didn't make it and trailed 21-20 with 4:10 left to play.
Norfolk Academy bobbled the ensuing kickoff, and the Bulldogs, who fell to 4-2, were pinned at their 1-yard line. They couldn't move the ball and punted. Atlantic Shores' Jordan Cannady fielded the punt at the Bulldogs' 34-yard line and scampered down the right sideline for a touchdown. A two-point conversion to put Atlantic Shores ahead 28-21 with 2:04 left.
The Bulldogs took over at their 35-yard line and drove for the tying TD. Quarterback Christian Randolph connected with Luke Frazier on a 3-yard touchdown pass with 37 seconds left, and the Bulldogs kicked the extra point that knotted the score at 28.
Beginning overtime at the 10-yard line, Norfolk Academy needed only two plays to score, capped by Randolph's 8-yard run, and the extra point put the Bulldogs ahead 35-28.
The Seahawks also only needed two plays to score, with Chamberlain providing the finishing touches with a 2-yard push up the middle. Atlantic Shores again opted to go for two, and Chamberlain's pass to Anthony Fries was on target.
Chamberlain rushed for 98 yards and scored three touchdowns on 30 carries. He also completed 9 of 16 passes for 79 yards.
Robinson paved the way for Norfolk Academy with 109 yards rushing on just nine carries.
Key stats : NA-Wentz 7-17 rushing, 3-25, TD receiving; Randolph 8-9 rushing; Tabor 5-14 rushing; Estep 2-54 receiving.
